bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander G. Clark to William F. Wharton, December 3, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 20th, 1890.
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, November 20th, 1890.
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assistant Sec'y of State, Wasington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to enclose my account, which I trust you will find correct. I have the honor to advise, that I have this day drawn two (2) Drafts on the Secretary of State covering the amount balance dew me.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient servant.
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul Gen'l.
